properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 3:09PM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as
25 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Essex, Caledonia and Washington Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this
evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
from 4 AM to 10 AM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult, especially the morning
commute. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or
evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area later tonight
and become moderate to heavy during the early morning hours on
Thursday. Snow intensity will decrease by late morning with
snowfall tapering off during the afternoon hours.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY
